review_title: Progressive, ethical, and fun . . . but not easy
job_title: Program Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
Ethical, caring leaders who listen to your concerns and provide mentorship. 
Good compensation and benefits. Including the 36 hour workweek. 
Heavy emphasis on training and professional development. 
Growing with an organization that is highly progressive/dynamic. 
Collegial, humanizing vibe between coworkers. It often makes working with an intense, complex population into an inspirational experience.
cons: The population served is intensely symptomatic in a lot of cases. So it’s not light and easy. The collegiality between staff members can definitely make that better, but this is not cushy work. Also with the expectation of high quality work, and the need to navigate a fair amount of red tape from funding and third-party payer organizations, it takes a lot of diligence, and a fair amount of critical thinking. i’ve worked here several years in various roles. The programs are constantly evolving, and while that generally is exciting and useful, it can be a downside as well, because of the complexity, and all the bugs that have to be worked out with new programs. When you move up to a new position, you’re off and hitting something up that has not been done before. Being able to tolerate ambiguity during these times of change is a must for those who are going to have longevity and upward progression. You will face change, progress and ambiguity, and your leaders will expect you to speak up about changes that may be needed.

job_title: Human Resources Generalist/Housing Support in Salt Lake City, UT

job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Working for this company has been an incredible experience. I have never worked for a company where the Head Executive Director truly cares about every person within the company. The HR teach always checks in, especially during hard times to see how they can support. When I was on my maternity leave, they were always calling to check on me and baby. My direct supervisor is always available. She listens to my concerns, ideas and feedback. When constructive feedback is given, it's never belittling. Each person I come into contact with in the organization is friendly and open. First Step House takes a lot of pride on making we are inclusive, compassion and understanding of every individuals needs. Not only the staff, but the clients we serve. When I need personal time off, I'm never made to feel bad about it and it's never questioned. If you want to work at a place that you will enjoy coming every day, First Step House is it!
cons: Truly I don't have anything negative to say about First Step House.

review_title: One of the best places, period
job_title: Accounting in Salt Lake City, UT
pros:
First Step House is the first place I've ever worked where the mission and strategy are clear and where management actively strives to create a healthy, strong corporate culture.  There is a deliberate and intentional focus on mission and success, so if you want to be part of a successful organization - if you have high standards and you can hold yourself accountable - this just might be the place for you.  
There are company-wide goals, department goals and program goals that FSH aims for, and as a part of reaching these goals, there is regular reporting, reviewing and evaluations.  
I was pleasantly surprised to find the compensation & bonus structure quite comparable to the for-profit world. 
Summary: 
Mission and strategy clear and well supported? Yes
Systems for employee success in place? Yes
Compensation appropriate? Yes
Employees supported by mgt and given the tools they need to succeed? Yes.
Organization experiencing growth? Yes
cons: If you are not comfortable with holding yourself accountable and with regular evaluation, this might not be a good fit for you.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: First Step House is a special organization. The Executive Team truly cares about the overall culture of the organization; they offer relevant trainings to staff to further professional development, they are actively expanding the organization to meet our mission and vision,  and they are consistently available to listen and offer advice to staff. If this is the field that you are interested in being a part of in order to help people rebuild their lives, this is an excellent organization to be a part of. FSH invests in bettering every employee, and they expect that you work hard to better the organization in return.
cons: With any quickly expanding company, there are occasional gaps or lapses in the overall organization of new programs. It is a fast-paced environment and you must take the initiative.  Career paths aren't always clear on how to move up in the organization.

review_title: Some supervisors are good and some are not so good.
job_title: Case Manager in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: This company really does care about helping the clients they serve. The therapists, nurses, and support staff really do care about their clients and work above and beyond to help them. You get more holidays than other companies I have worked for in Utah and the benefits are pretty good.
cons: Some of the supervisors are not that great. They can have a tendency to micro manage when it is not needed. It started to seem like I was working in 1984 and my every move was being monitored. Pay is not good.

review_title: Wonderful company with meaningful values, excellent leadership, and daily inspiration
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: My favorite reasons why I love working at FSH are because of the people and because of our constant efforts to enhance our mission statement - to help people build lives of meaning, purpose, and recovery. Really, both these reasons go hand in hand. I believe that the people you work with are almost more important than the work you do. That said, I work with some of the most compassionate and truly hardworking rock stars on the planet. Every day I'm amazed by the kindness and generosity of my coworkers. Second, FSH strives to be the best in our field in order to provide premier services to our clients and our community. While we continually strive to perfect our treatment and miscellaneous services (like access to dental care for men who haven't seen a dentist in a decade... or more), our leadership looks into the future and sees what else is out there. I can honestly say that I've never worked in an organization with a collective pair of eyes continuously towards the horizon rather than doting on past achievements. Last, I know that I have room for growth within this organization, and it's really great to know that I have a future within a flourishing, eyes-on-the-horizon organization. All in all, I would say that I enjoy working at FSH so much because I'm inspired daily, and it's my pleasure to be a part of the FSH team.
cons: There's so much to do - it's hard to keep up! But this is a good problem to have. As I mentioned above, our leadership is ambitious, and it's a welcome challenge to try to work as hard as they do.

review_title: A company that is client centered and employee focused.

pros: Client centered care, supervisors/managers who use and teach from an evidence based leadership course. FSH works hard to find the best employees and even harder to keep them!
